pageContext.claim: “Starting soon, if you're a person who lives in California, you only get 50 gallons of water. Now, it sounds like a lot of water, but it’s not. … Then it goes down to 47, 46, 45. Can you imagine?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump twists just enough to merit a fact check. California enacted a law limiting residents to 55 gallons of water use -- but that's per person, per day. The limit gradually decreases to 52.5 gallons in 2025 and 50 gallons in 2030.
